title: England: home and beauty
brief_description: Domestic architecture, interior furnishing and the design of household objects were the subject of a protracted debate during the 1930’s. To increase Britain’s export sales, standards of design had to be raised, but there was no consensus for either of the two contenders-Bauhaus and Swedish inspired functionalism on the one hand or the jazzy modernistic Art Deco style on the other
